thread.title: Don’t forget that better-off seniors already pay more
thread.title_full: Don’t forget that better-off seniors already pay more - The Washington Post

author: John Woodrow Cox
title: Don’t forget that better-off seniors already pay more
text:
(Cristian Casanelles @tempura/iStock) October 20 at 5:55 PM A person reading the Oct. 18 editorial “ A costly glitch ,” which stated that higher-income seniors may be expected to pay more for Medicare Part B, might reasonably infer that better-off seniors don’t already pay more. They do, in the form of income taxes on their Social Security benefits and higher Medicare premiums. Depending on income, they may pay as much as $335.70 for Part B , more than triple the base amount.
That premium apparently could rise to about $504 unless things change. I do not complain that the “better off” pay more. But I am weary of hearing they should with no recognition that they already do.
Michael Cogswell , Vienna
